721158f-a.folder: MacDougal Street & Houston Street, Manhattan, NY
721158f-a.text:
(1)
A bit of early New York, 69 to 77 MacDougal Street, on the west
side, north of Houston Street.
August 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
77 to 71 MacDougal Street, the same group of houses seen from the north, six years later. The Roma Restaurant has become The Fortunio. No. o9, the house adjoining it on the south, has been remodelled out of recognition, leaving only four out of the original six houses in this group. No. 67 was demolished
some time hetween 1922 and 1927.
May 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

721159f-a.text:
(1)
MacDougal Street, east side, from Houston Street towards Bleecker
Street.
June 15, 1930.

721165f-a.folder: MacDougal Street & Houston Street, Manhattan, NY
721165f-a.text:
Macdougal Street, west side, from Houston Street to West 3rd (formerly Amity) Street, where the Sixth Avenue Elevated crosses Macdougal Street, and north. In the background is one of the new apartment houses on Washington Square West (.v.), and at the end of the vista the Empire State Building, the tallest office building in the world. 59 Macdougal Street at the S.W. corner of Houston, and 6l to 67 inclusive, at and adjoining the N.W. corner, were demolished late in 1V29 when work began on the Houston Street branch of the Independent (municipal) Subway.
February 2O, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, at a later date. Note the play space on the north side of Houston Street, between MacDougal Street and Sixth Ave. Extension.
February 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

724510f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY
724510f-a.text:
140 to 148 West Houston Street, north side, east of, adjoining and at the N.E. corner of MacDougal Street, and west. Between MacDougal Street and Sixth Avenue (Extension) all the old houses were
demolished in 1927.
May 23, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

724511f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY
724511f-a.text:
Houston Street, east from and including No. 142 West, on the north side of MacDougal Street. A branch of the municipal subway is under construction under Houston Street itself and under the sit of the houses which used to be on the south side. This picture shows an intermediate stage of construction by the "cut-and-cover" method. This branch will not be opened till 1936.

This view shows almost all of the original Houston Street. The dark building in the background is 604-608 Broadway, where Houston Street met the western end of North Street (now East Houston Street), East Houston Street does not make a right angle with Broadway, but bends a little north.

June 15, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

724515f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & MacDougal Street, Manhattan, NY
724515f-a.text:
West Houston Street, south side, east from Sixth Ave., to and including Macdougal Street.
May 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
